column1: Designating 9-8-8 as the National Suicide Prevention and Mental Crisis Hotline will help save lives.  I'm proud to join @RepDonBeyer in a push for legislation to activate this  important service. https://t.co/xiHRDxRkbI

I'm pleased my staff was able to present Mr. Tim Cooke with a Congressional Certificate to recognize his years of outstanding work as Director of the Martinsburg VA Medical Center.  Thank you for your service to the veterans of #VA10  Mr. Cooke! https://t.co/hXLeJfzPi0

At this week's @HouseScience hearing on the impacts of climate change I spoke about the importance of sustainable land management and why we need to incentivize our farmers to adopt more climate-friendly practices—many of which have substantial economic payoffs as well. https://t.co/zUIFOJjztn

I met with @HECSEducation yesterday to discuss the importance of preparing qualified special education teachers and the shortage of these professionals we're facing.  I'll continue working to ensure we have an education system that meets the needs of every student. https://t.co/giJP4z8dyn

Congratulations to the winners of our 2019 #VA10 Photo Contest!  Jacqueline's photo of Algonkian Regional Park took home the first place and Sophia Ava and Brandon all were selected as runners-up.  Thank you to everyone who helped show off the best of #VA10! https://t.co/8mz3btmvLf
In light of Trump officially nominating goldbug Judy Shelton to the Fed I’m just gonna leave this here 👇 https://t.co/kRh2BWZes8

If students from #VA10 are cheated by predatory for-profit colleges I want to—at least—make sure their loans can be forgiven.  That's why I voted to overturn a @usedgov rule implemented by @BetsyDeVosED that makes it nearly impossible for those student to seek debt relief. https://t.co/bIWCeL7t6c

The new report from @USGAO makes clear what we have known and argued all along—withholding congressionally-approved taxpayer-funded aid to Ukraine is illegal.  The Trump administration broke the law. https://t.co/AX8q4ZMh2D

Thanks to the ACA Medicaid Expansion has covered over 375k Virginians.  But Americans need to know that *right now* the President is in court fighting to strike down the ACA with no replacement.  Medicaid Expansion saves lives.   The ACA saves lives.  We have to #ProtectOurCare. https://t.co/8zabHThUqu

Tonight I voted to pass the bipartisan #POWADA to ensure older workers are protected against age discrimination.  This is a growing issue for older Virginians that should be treated just as seriously as any other form of workplace discrimination. https://t.co/YYfTvOWELX

.@FSCDems held an important hearing today with @ADL @splcenter & others where we discussed domestic terrorism and ways to detect & disrupt this growing threat.  One thing is clear: more can be done through the use of financial intel to intervene in the planning of these attacks. https://t.co/FYbgDfGx4h

Today both chambers of the Virginia General Assembly voted to ratify the Equal Rights Amendment.  This is a historic step and I'm proud to stand with all those in the fight for equality.  It's past time that women be represented in the Constitution.  #ERANOW https://t.co/CEaPfg0z06

I just voted to send articles of impeachment from the House to the Senate.  It's now up to the Senate to conduct a full and fair trial—that must include access to any relevant evidence and testimony from key witnesses.  The American people deserve nothing less.

Are you curious how financing a sound system for an NFL stadium helps low-to-middle-income borrowers gain access to credit?  It doesn't—but that's what the Trump administration and the Republican witness are trying to argue.  It didn’t go so well.   Watch this👇 https://t.co/ndAcY84rjT

This morning I met with Sujay and Isaiah from @AMSANational to discuss legislation I've helped pass to lower the cost of prescription drugs.  Thank you both for your advocacy—I'll keep working to make health care more affordable and accessible for all Americans. https://t.co/gaTImqEoq3

🎵Country roads take me home To the place I belong...🎶 . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . the Commonwealth of Virginia. 🥰  Thank you but no thank you to the Mountain State. Frederick County is right at home here in #VA10. 😉 https://t.co/WWFm8pyxzq
Don't forget—we'll be tallying the final votes at 10 p.m.! https://t.co/eFWEa0wkwV

A new study suggests that thousands of overdoses may have been prevented in states that have expanded Medicaid.  Medicaid Expansion under the ACA has been critical to addressing the opioid epidemic—getting people the care they need & helping to save lives. https://t.co/N6DALSerNR

Donald Trump had nothing to do with securing protections for preexisting conditions.  He’s in court—right now—fighting to strike down the Affordable Care Act & eliminate protections for preexisting conditions.  Don't let this President’s lies go unchallenged.  #ProtectOurCare https://t.co/SSP1l6x8Ek

ICYMI: Big pharma is already hiking prices on consumers.  I helped pass the #LowerDrugCostsNow Act to give Medicare the power to negotiate lower drug prices for all Americans.  We need the Senate to take action on this legislation immediately. https://t.co/U0hwEqBTgd

Have you checked out the finalists for our #VA10 photo contest?  You still have time to vote for the winners by liking your favorites on my Facebook page.   Voting closes on Monday at 10 p.m.!  https://t.co/fg95UjA2kq https://t.co/t9O7BSt9u1

Thank you to the AMAZING @VirginiaDMV mobile team for bringing DMV services directly to #VA10 constituents—completing 245 transactions—during today's special REAL ID event at my Sterling district office.  Couldn’t make it? Learn more about REAL ID here: https://t.co/KDLdwc4GD3 https://t.co/CU2U7Ovcj9

Thank you to everyone who has expressed interest in today’s special REAL ID Application Event with the DMV mobile team at my Sterling district office.  We’re almost at capacity so we’re encouraging constituents to consider other mobile DMV events: 🚗➡️https://t.co/NmnGn0xRiG

Tycho’s app Stream Scorer automatically analyzes water quality data & generates a score of stream health for Virginia certified stream monitors—making stream monitoring easier quicker & more accurate. He’ll demo his app on Capitol Hill this spring.   Keep coding #VA10! https://t.co/81YEWShpEZ

Thank you to all of the talented #VA10 middle & high school students who participated in our annual Congressional App Challenge.  This morning I was excited to announce Tycho Svoboda as this year’s winner—congratulations Tycho!  #Congress4CS https://t.co/ruBNTbpwlU

Yesterday I participated in an important briefing on anti-Semitism and domestic terrorism with the @HomelandDems.  Anti-Semitic violence has been on the rise in our country and the responsibility is on all of us to call it out and take measures to address it. https://t.co/d4nficLm4j

The ACA provides vital coverage and health stability for Americans with disabilities: ➡️protections for pre-existing conditions ➡️coverage for millions through Medicaid Expansion ➡️elimination of lifetime caps on coverage   Repealing the ACA is not an option.   #ProtectOurCare https://t.co/GA6pJQQisf

PFAS chemicals are “forever chemicals” linked to several adverse health effects.   Today I voted to protect the public health by passing the bipartisan PFAS Action Act.  Every American deserves clean drinking water and a healthy environment to live in.  https://t.co/bI8NSOxJfr

The American people are not seeking a war with Iran nor did Congress authorize one.  I voted for this War Powers Resolution to make clear that Congress—not the President—has the power to declare war.  I will not allow this President to plunge us into another ill-advised war. https://t.co/cwrOYZR6QO
Happy #LawEnforcement Appreciation Day to all of the brave men and women who help keep us safe.  Thank you for your service to the people of #VA10! https://t.co/3o3gw6PhuS

The ACA has been a lifeline for the 135 million Americans with pre-existing conditions.  But right now in court the Trump administration is trying to take us back to a time when insurance companies could deny coverage just for being pregnant or having cancer. #ProtectOurCare https://t.co/mlfocBNBYY

Hey #VA10 I've got some exciting news—the finalists from our first ever photo contest have just been announced!  Check out my Facebook page below to "like" your favorites and determine the winners.  Voting closes on Monday at 10 p.m. https://t.co/S4HyNFSVdp https://t.co/uCaWR6BcKz

Trump's DOJ doesn't decide whether women are equal under the law.  The power to amend the Constitution lies with Congress and the states. I look forward to Virginia becoming the 38th and final state to ratify the ERA.   @RepSpeier is right—there's no expiration date on equality. https://t.co/A35cVLn9Xv

This clause from @RepSlotkin's War Powers Resolution sums up why this vote is so important.  When the United States uses military force the American people and Congress deserve a credible explanation.  I’m cosponsoring this legislation and will be supporting it tomorrow. https://t.co/fPZDc5GE1p

With science and federal workers' rights under attack it's more important than ever to have a strong EPA.  That's why I've helped launch the EPA workers' bill of rights with @AFGENational who are fighting to #ProtectEPA and protect our environment. https://t.co/gvFVp3dJxd

.@GabbyGiffords is right we're defined by how we respond to tragedy and hardship.  That's why—one year ago today—@HouseDemocrats introduced #HR8 to require universal background checks. It's past time @senatmajIdr hold a vote on this life-saving legislation. https://t.co/O8KfjHNKPR

In 2019 I held 7 district-wide town halls all around #VA10.  Our democracy works best when citizens can make themselves heard and hearing directly from you is important to me.  Sign up for my newsletter to find out when my next town hall will be: https://t.co/HXTT4cYAxv https://t.co/fg7uVduqNA
I’m praying for the safety of the brave American soldiers and personnel stationed in Iraq right now. https://t.co/jrcS7PDmQT

#MedicaidExpansion has saved lives.   If the Trump administration is successful in its effort to repeal the ACA in court 375000 Virginians who are covered thanks to Medicaid Expansion could be at risk of losing that life-saving care.  That's why I'm fighting to #ProtectOurCare. https://t.co/yVIfLZdv1q

In 2019 I personally visited 200+ small businesses farms schools & nonprofits to meet constituents in every part of #VA10.  We also hosted 14 mobile office hours all around our district to bring our services directly to you.  In 2020 I’ve got no intention of slowing down!🏃‍♀️ https://t.co/SvFzm0octT

I recently introduced legislation to establish an @NSF prize competition to spark new deepfake detection technology & authored an amendment to improve the public's detection of deepfakes.  If @Facebook won’t take this threat seriously then Congress must. https://t.co/JeBrCxFhXp

Call it what you want—deepfake or cheapfake—it’s still disinformation and @Facebook needs to do more to stop it from spreading.  Last year I pressed Mark Zuckerberg on his lack of a plan to combat deepfakes & his refusal to remove a deceptively edited video of @SpeakerPelosi. https://t.co/NQkWnqoJ8T https://t.co/euTLisKhNM

On #JewishandProud Day I stand firmly with the Jewish community as an ally.  We all need to speak out against rising antisemitism and the recent violence against our Jewish neighbors in New York.  Hate has no place in #VA10 or anywhere in America. https://t.co/WQgM7VIPCD

I’m pleased to see the Debbie Smith Reauthorization Act of 2019 was signed into law last week.  I voted for this bill because we need to end the rape kit testing backlog in America including an estimated 2300 kits in Virginia. https://t.co/t9f80cJ13Q

I'm proud to announce that my office has closed over 1000 cases in service to the people of #VA10!   Whether you have questions about Medicare or need help securing VA benefits—we're ready to assist you.  Please don't hesitate to reach out: https://t.co/suRs2U22Ob https://t.co/fO6S0XSQpB

The President threatened to commit war crimes on Twitter last night and today he doubled down on that declaration.  We don’t target cultural sites or civilians Mr. President. We are not the Taliban or ISIS.  And only Congress—not you—has the power to declare war. https://t.co/IuwaB2MxuX

Climate change is real.   It’s happening now—and it's only going to get worse if we don't take urgent action.   I’m thinking of everyone fighting the devastating #AustraliaFires. https://t.co/1cuiJKT3o0

This morning I attended the @LoudounCoGovt Board of Supervisors swearing-in ceremony—congratulations to everyone serving on the board!   I look forward to partnering with all of our local leaders to improve our schools roads and quality of life here in Loudoun and #VA10. https://t.co/3jTyHBv1Y4

Our criminal justice system is out of balance—and it has been for a long time.  Decriminalization of marijuana and parole reform are just some of the common-sense changes that will help create a more fair and equitable justice system for all Virginians.  https://t.co/l6CL8XV0rD

ICYMI: Serving #VA10 in Congress means that I stay busy every day whether it's fighting to lower the cost of prescription drugs or meeting with constituents to hear their concerns.   Check out @LoudounNow's coverage of a regular day on Capitol Hill for me.https://t.co/w8rp55vhPs

My @HouseDemocrats colleagues and I along with Attorneys General across the country are fighting to end the partisan attack on Americans' health care.  The health and safety of millions of Americans are at stake if Trump and Republicans are successful in this sabotage. https://t.co/KeeolP68uD

Article 1 of the Constitution places the power to declare war and authorize military force with Congress not the President.  I’m cosponsoring the bipartisan #AUMF Clarification Act because there can be no war with Iran without the express approval of Congress—that must be clear. https://t.co/yrUqSFvDgK

Suleimani was a brutal killer who deserved to meet justice but President Trump’s airstrike has brought us to the brink of war with no clear strategy or plan.  The American people are not seeking a war with Iran nor did Congress authorize one.

Ready to get your REAL ID? I'm partnering with @VirginiaDMV to host a special REAL ID event with DMV Connect on Saturday January 11 at my Sterling District office.  Stop by with your proof documents and apply for your REAL ID with DMV’s mobile team! https://t.co/tKgJdpxQeD

I'm proud that my office answered over 42000 letters and emails and more than 4000 calls from #VA10 constituents in 2019!  Hearing directly from you is the best way for me to serve the interests of our community.  Here's how to get in touch: https://t.co/4vuvsorMW5 https://t.co/hnD6ZAAv61

The Trump administration's continued assault on the rights of the LGBTQ community underscores the need to guarantee equal protection under the law for ALL Americans.  We passed the #EqualityAct over six months ago—it's time for the Senate to take action. https://t.co/Fhal0JgmLq

The last decade has been fraught with political turmoil and division but we also saw hope and change persist.  In 2020 I’m looking forward to bringing more hope and change to our politics.  Happy New Year #VA10. Thank you for allowing me the privilege of representing you. https://t.co/NsaNgDQjKK

In 2019 we secured paid leave for all federal employees and an average pay raise of 3.1% for our federal workforce.   I’m proud to have introduced  3 bipartisan bills and authored 6 amendments that have all passed in the House.   In 2020 I’m ready to keep working for #VA10. https://t.co/tYFCQGEtuk

This is great news for federal workers and their families in #VA10!  Securing a pay raise for federal workers was a top priority for me this year—I'm proud my colleagues and I were able to negotiate this much-needed raise. https://t.co/cJIfnxKHC8

It's one of the greatest honors of my life to be able to call @RepJohnLewis my colleague.  He's been a fighter all his life and I have no doubt he will beat this.    He's right "We still have many bridges to cross." https://t.co/BESCzKMchv

I'm celebrating the final night of #Hanukkah at home with Andrew and the boys.  I hope that light casts out darkness and that joy and peace fill the homes of all those celebrating in #VA10 and around the world. https://t.co/TrdivD8Zeh

My heart is with the Jewish community in Monsey New York who suffered a devastating act of violence as they celebrated Hanukkah last night.   The rise of Anti-Semitism in America must be confronted and it must be strongly condemned by each of us. https://t.co/v62EUDHvBP

This is a great policy to help young people make their voices heard. Democracy works best when every citizen is engaged.  #VA10 students: your voice matters—visit my Capitol Hill office anytime. Let's talk about the issues that matter to you. https://t.co/iSqMXJvV6j

In the midst of the holiday season I want to extend a thank you to our pilots flight attendants air traffic controllers TSA agents and all of the hard working people who help us arrive to our destinations safely and on time.   As you travel remember to be patient & kind.

This is the third holiday season the Ghaisars will spend without their son Bijan who was unarmed when killed by the US Park Police.  Now the DOJ is blocking FBI testimony—preventing state prosecutors from seeking justice for Bijan.  It’s disgraceful. https://t.co/9seS1JnfCQ
Wishing a very happy #Kwanzaa to all those celebrating in #VA10 and around the world! https://t.co/vDY3Vu1aAu

This month I voted for the #LowerDrugCostsNow Act to finally give @HHSGov the power to negotiate lower drug prices for the American people.   We have miracle drugs that can save lives but they don't do any good if Americans can't afford them.  https://t.co/tJF3PB3Cg4
From the Wexton family to yours—merry Christmas #VA10! https://t.co/FbLSSk3E81

All I want for Christmas is for Senator Mitch McConnell to give us a vote on the hundreds of House-passed bills collecting dust on his desk.  Like the Grinch whose heart grew 3 sizes it’s not too late for you @senatemajldr. https://t.co/kDCxKJCTGs

Saudi Arabia’s verdict for the death of Jamal Khashoggi is a sham—but we expect this behavior from brutal dictators.   What should upset every American is the Trump administration’s stunning refusal to hold the Crown Prince accountable for this murder. https://t.co/p30idyRyZ0

Virginia has two statues in our nation’s Capitol and Robert E. Lee does not represent the best of our history.   I’m working alongside @RepMcEachin and @GovernorVA to ensure we honor those who have worked to advance equality and justice for all Virginians. https://t.co/uahSvtYx1m
The new Miss America Camille Schrier is a biochemist from Virginia.   That’s pretty cool—congratulations Camille! 👩‍🔬🧪 https://t.co/GfL36KiL11

.@Settle_the_Debt is doing amazing work to eliminate school lunch debt here in #VA10. But no child should be treated unfairly for lunch debt that they aren't responsible for.   That's why I'll keep fighting for funding for critical child nutrition programs.https://t.co/ET7CCHQ39Z

It was an honor to light the shamash to kick off the celebration of #Hanukkah with the Chabad of Loudoun this evening.  Hanukkah is a story of resilience that reminds us—even in the darkest moments—a stubborn light flickers.   There’s always hope. We should never lose faith. https://t.co/kaSD07xt1y
I'm wishing a speedy recovery to all of those injured in today's crash and want to thank all of the first responders.  Please travel safe this holiday season #VA10! https://t.co/Xqxau2QdOx

ICYMI: Huge win for #VA10!  I helped pass a bill that would eliminate the State and Local Tax (SALT) cap that unfairly penalizes families in our district.   213500 households in #VA10 claim this deduction—it's time for this unfair & punitive law to end. https://t.co/RAsQwbehwT

I'm working hard every day to deliver for the people of #VA10 on important issues like health care gun violence prevention and strengthening the middle class.   Thank you @LoudounNow for sharing what a typical day on Capitol Hill is like for my office. https://t.co/w8rp55vhPs

This is great news for Northern Virginia & #VA10 that will help make our rail system work better for everyone.   This agreement will expand rail service and relieve congestion helping passengers and businesses alike.  Thank you @GovernorVA for your work!https://t.co/2QAj1McmQj

The American people sent us to Congress with a list of priorities—a holiday wishlist if you will.  We've passed over 400 bills in the House but we need the Senate to vote on them.  @senatemajldr—like the Grinch whose heart grew 3 sizes—you can still deliver on that wishlist. https://t.co/6eXvswWESf

I voted to pass USMCA because trade is crucial to #VA10's economy—from rural Frederick County to the Dulles Tech Corridor.  After months of renegotiation by Democrats USMCA will ensure that #VA10 businesses continue to thrive & that workers are protected.https://t.co/AxHME8N4kk

Today I spoke on the House floor in support of H.R. 5377 to eliminate the SALT cap & help put money back in the pockets of 150000 households right here #VA10.  This is an unfair policy that punishes Virginia families—I'm proud the House voted to restore this tax relief today. https://t.co/3OqhqjtLic

Today I introduced legislation that would establish a prize competition at @NSF to help spur greater innovation & research into technologies that can detect deepfakes.  This will expand the tools available to address this growing threat to our democracy. https://t.co/TR0gcpixot

The facts are uncontested and the truth is inescapable—President Donald Trump abused his power and obstructed Congress.  Today I cast my vote to impeach the President with a heavy heart and a solemn sense of duty to protect our Constitution. https://t.co/U4eVHG1PeT

The stakes of this case could not be higher. Health care coverage for millions of Americans Medicaid Expansion and protections for individuals with pre-existing conditions are all in jeopardy.  I'm fighting to #ProtectOurCare and stop this sabotage. https://t.co/5M9LcVbwNV
Happy birthday to my amazing husband Andrew. Thanks for 20 wonderful years!  P.S. I’m gonna have to take a rain check on tonight’s date night 🙃 https://t.co/nmmHEsAc4Z

.@RepMcEachin sent me this note as I decided whether to run for Congress.  I've reflected on Thomas Paine's words “These are the times that try men’s souls" frequently—but never more than today.   I refuse to be a sunshine patriot and history will remember how we vote. https://t.co/L3oSjwIup1

We've also secured record funding levels for Head Start Child Care and Development Block Grants and Title I schools to help #VA10 kids succeed.  Our kids deserve every opportunity we can provide to help them live up to their full potential. https://t.co/h1AenLm0y7

Today's budget deal allocates a historic $25 million to research the gun violence epidemic at the @NIH and @CDCgov.  For the first time in 20 years we will finally address gun violence as the urgent public health emergency that it is. https://t.co/PAscCbwI8n

This year's budget agreement includes a 3.1% pay raise for all federal workers something I've fought for since I came to Congress.  This will help us attract and retain the best and brightest into public service. https://t.co/o2HutNnDGk

Lurching from one continuing resolution to another is no way to run a government.  There are critical legislative & funding priorities for #VA10 reflected in today's spending bills but—most importantly—we’ve averted another devastating government shutdown.https://t.co/b4kUqmYPRC

REMINDER: The deadline to receive coverage through https://t.co/wt5qIKP2eB has been extended through 3 am ET on Wednesday December 18.   Don’t miss your chance to #GetCovered: https://t.co/4tEtpqxCUo https://t.co/DHTB5aCmob

Yesterday we passed two bipartisan bills to improve accuracy in broadband mapping.  This is important because many rural communities in #VA10 do not have access to broadband making it difficult to apply for a job contact a health care provider and do business. https://t.co/ZOmlEzWXj7

Watch the @nytimes' full video here where @blueshirt assembles his own ghost gun here in Virginia (without law enforcement knowing) and discusses the impact of ghost guns on our existing laws.  https://t.co/sGPcJHNBga

Ghost guns are self-assembled firearms which can be easily built from kits or 3D printed. They don't come with a serial number making them completely untraceable and extremely dangerous in the hands of bad actors.  I discussed the grave threat ghost guns pose with @nytimes. https://t.co/gY3EsH5d6P

Good news—because of glitches experienced yesterday on https://t.co/wt5qIKP2eB Open Enrollment will be extended beginning today at 3pm.  The new deadline to #GetCovered is 3am EST on December 18th.  Help spread the word! https://t.co/Yd3EhwaVxm

On January 3rd 2019 I took an oath to uphold and defend the Constitution of the United States.  I did not come to Congress to impeach the President but his actions have left us no choice.  I will be voting for both articles of impeachment against President Trump. https://t.co/n6YIDcA6Wh

This is completely unacceptable. The Trump administration has already shortened the time period to enroll and these glitches only create another barrier to people getting the affordable health care they need.  @CMSGov must extend the deadline. https://t.co/JDUYmVP2X2

Due to the winter weather and concern for the safety of our staff my Winchester office will be closed until conditions improve.  In the meantime please feel free to contact my Sterling or Washington DC offices. https://t.co/kffmOgyTmu

Every federal employee takes an oath—the same as the President—to defend the Constitution.  In the face of unprecedented pressure and attacks career public servants upheld that oath to protect our democracy.  @TIME’s Guardians of the Year: Public Servants.https://t.co/g6h45M7IY8
The deadline to #GetCovered is TODAY December 15.   Head to https://t.co/wt5qIKP2eB to find a plan that works for you.   Talk to your friends and family to make sure they're covered too!

Virginia ratifying the #ERA would send a powerful message to the rest of the country—that “Equal Justice Under Law” is a Constitutional right for women.   It’s past time that women be included in our country’s founding document. https://t.co/ojipfAuST9

This afternoon I joined @AAUW for their annual Christmas luncheon to discuss my work serving alongside a historic number of women in the most diverse Congress in our history.  Together we’re working every day to empower women & their families across America. https://t.co/nomXwC0RRf

Seven years ago today we lost 26 beautiful souls to a horrific act of gun violence.  I’m fighting in Congress every day to #EndGunViolence and ensure that no child ever has to be afraid in their own classroom.  Our kids deserve better. https://t.co/2mhR6egGuv

Open Enrollment in the Health Insurance Marketplace ends in just a couple of days—don't miss your chance to #GetCovered with an affordable plan that meets your needs before the December 15th deadline!  Visit https://t.co/wt5qIKP2eB to learn more. https://t.co/yFu4zgap30

Last night I hosted a reception in the Capitol for the veterans who serve on #VA10's Service Academy Advisory Board.   We are proud to have such incredible applicants this year and I am so grateful to our judges who lent their expertise for more than 100 interviews. https://t.co/I2uD6QVMrd

Four years after the signing of the historic #ParisAgreement to confront the global threat of climate change our message is that #WeAreStillIn.  I was proud to vote for the #ClimateActionNow Act in May to affirm America's commitment to addressing this crisis. https://t.co/UZdsW8N6SR

PASSED: #HR3 the Elijah Cummings #LowerDrugCosts Now Act.  Prescription drugs work—but not if Americans can't afford them.  With #HR3 @HHSGov can stop paying whatever drug companies charge and finally use its buying power to negotiate lower drug prices for all Americans. https://t.co/zvVBPAfn9d

What happened in Jersey City is heartbreaking and infuriating.   The rise of anti-Semitic bigotry and violence in our country should alarm every American.  We must act urgently to combat the growing threat of hate and violence. https://t.co/hx5xwQrrLN

USDA's refusal to comply with congressional oversight inquiries raises serious questions about their decision-making process on the relocation of key research agencies.  Today I led members of @HouseScience to request that @USGAO provide us a full accounting of this relocation. https://t.co/W9Q88Zn1hx

Tonight @HouseJudiciary will begin markup on articles of impeachment.   Meanwhile I’m presiding over debate on #HR3 the Elijah Cummings #LowerDrugCostsNow Act.  I believe the pundits call this walking and chewing gum at the same time.   👩‍⚖️🍬 https://t.co/t5vUEDDqTv

I just voted to pass the final NDAA including paid parental leave for all federal workers and my amendment supporting servicemembers' transition into the intelligence workforce. https://t.co/r9LVLnkLZE
Hey @realDonaldTrump now do @USDA and @BLMNational. https://t.co/MrK0Sohcyf

REMINDER: Open Enrollment in the Health Insurance Marketplace has already begun and you only have until December 15 to #GetCovered.  Make sure you visit https://t.co/wt5qIKP2eB to find a plan that's right for you before the deadline! https://t.co/7KMynJhUlv

The inability to afford medication should not be a death sentence in America.  Without this bill the rising price of prescription drugs will continue to take a toll on the finances of #VA10 families and—in the worst cases—cost lives.  We need to pass the #LowerDrugCostsNow Act. https://t.co/gIjqiM9He7

This morning I joined @BMHCaucus for an update on maternal health research from @NIH.  We’re in a crisis—black women are 3-4x more likely to die from pregnancy-related complications.  We discussed ways to end this disparity and improve health conditions for all new mothers. https://t.co/B4QoDkqSsG

Over time the national memorial will serve as a report on which parts of the country have confronted the truth of this terror and which have not.  Here are the photos of the monuments that represent counties in Virginia’s 10th Congressional district. https://t.co/wqZYUlY1p1
The memorial is more than a static monument. In the six-acre park surrounding the memorial is a field of identical monuments waiting to be claimed and installed in the counties they represent.

The names of the lynching victims are engraved on the columns. Nearly the entire inner courtyard of the memorial is filled with columns representing almost 50 Virginia counties where at least one lynching has been documented.

Set upon six acres the site includes a memorial square with 800 six-foot monuments to symbolize thousands of racial terror lynching victims in the United States and the counties and states where this terrorism took place. https://t.co/dxBOSePhNQ

According to @eji_org “More than 4400 African American men women and children were hanged burned alive shot drowned or beaten to death by white mobs between 1877 and 1950. Millions more fled the South as refugees from racial terrorism...”

From Essex Junction Vermont: "Some of us are young professionals just starting out... Some of us are the only source of income for our young families. Some of us are veterans. Now that we're facing work without pay I worry for my colleagues' health physical and mental."

From Manassas Virginia: "We have already been punished by this situation; we had to entirely give up our Christmas and I had to look at my kids and ask that they hold their money so we could buy food if this shutdown continued."
From Denver Colorado: "I'm getting worried about my mortgage payment coming up I barely managed to ensure my student loans are paid for this month and now I have to worry about food and other bills."

From Frederick Maryland: "If the shutdown goes on much longer I will be forced to take money out of my kids' college funds and my retirement savings. That comes with penalities that I'll never get back."

From Lithonia Georgia: "Many of our elderly residents are in jeopardy of not receiving their much-needed food stamps if the government shutdown does not end by the end of January 2019. These necessary funds for food are for basic survival due to their low incomes."
From Rockville Maryland: "I have a significant pre-existing condition and worry for not only my health but the financial security of our family."
